generation-number.label: (4.2) Three Generations
generation-number.description: Number of fermion generations from G₂ topology

steps: Start with G₂ manifold effective Euler characteristic χ_eff = 144
Apply G₂ index theorem: n_gen = χ_eff/48 (twice F-theory divisor)
Result: n_gen = 144/48 = 3 exactly

gut-scale.label: (5.3) GUT Scale
gut-scale.description: Grand unification scale from G₂ compactification volume

steps: G₂ manifold volume V_G2 determines effective 4D Planck scale
Dimensional reduction: M_GUT = M_Pl · V_G2^(-1/7)
From TCS topology: V_G2 yields M_GUT = 2.118×10¹⁶ GeV

dark-energy-w0.label: (7.1) Dark Energy EoS
dark-energy-w0.description: Dark energy equation of state from thermal time mechanism

steps: Thermal time flow from Pneuma statistics: H = -ln(ρ)
Apply MEP constraint for stationary vacuum
Result: w₀ = -1 + 2/(3α_T) with α_T = 4.5

proton-lifetime.label: (5.10) Proton Lifetime
proton-lifetime.description: Proton lifetime from GUT scale with TCS suppression

steps: Standard dimension-6 decay: τ_p ∝ M_GUT⁴/(α_GUT² m_p⁵)
TCS geometry provides additional suppression S = 2.1 from cycle separation
Result: τ_p = 8.15×10³⁴ years (4.9× Super-K bound)

gw-dispersion-alt.description: Alternative GW dispersion with phenomenological normalization

vacuum-minimization.label: (2.8) Vacuum Minimization Condition
vacuum-minimization.description: Vacuum stability condition for racetrack potential minimum

steps: Take derivative of V = |∂W/∂Ψ|² w.r.t. Ψ_P
Set to zero for stable vacuum
Solve transcendentally for ⟨Ψ_P⟩ ≈ 1.076

mirror-temp-ratio.label: (4.5a) Mirror Sector Temperature
mirror-temp-ratio.description: Mirror sector temperature ratio from G₂ topology

steps: Mirror sector couples through gravitational portal only
Temperature ratio from cycle volume ratio: T'/T = (Vol₂/Vol₃)^{1/4}
Use Betti numbers as proxy: T'/T = (b₂/b₃)^{1/4} = (4/24)^{1/4} = 0.57

pati-salam-chain.label: (5.1a) Pati-Salam Breaking Chain
pati-salam-chain.html: SO(10) → SU(4)<sub>C</sub> × SU(2)<sub>L</sub> × SU(2)<sub>R</sub> → SU(3)<sub>C</sub> × SU(2)<sub>L</sub> × U(1)<sub>Y</sub>
pati-salam-chain.description: Intermediate Pati-Salam symmetry breaking chain (geometrically preferred)

steps: First breaking: SO(10) → SU(4)_C × SU(2)_L × SU(2)_R at M_GUT
Second breaking: SU(4)_C → SU(3)_C × U(1)_{B-L} at intermediate scale
Final: SU(2)_R × U(1)_{B-L} → U(1)_Y at M_PS ~ 10^12 GeV

pati-salam-chain.notes: Provides right-handed neutrinos for seesaw mechanism

higgs-potential.label: (5.6a) Higgs Scalar Potential
higgs-potential.description: Standard Model Higgs potential from EWSB

steps: SU(2)_L × U(1)_Y gauge theory requires scalar doublet H
Most general renormalizable potential: V = -μ²|H|² + λ|H|⁴
Minimum at ⟨H⟩ = v_EW/√2 with v_EW² = μ²/λ

higgs-potential.notes: Minimization gives v_EW = 246 GeV and m_h = √(2λ)v_EW = 125 GeV

higgs-quartic.label: (5.6b) Higgs Quartic Coupling
higgs-quartic.description: Higgs self-coupling from observed Higgs mass

rg-running-couplings.label: (5.5c) RG Running of Gauge Couplings
rg-running-couplings.description: One-loop RG evolution equations for SM gauge couplings
rg-running-couplings.notes: Evolves from α_GUT = 1/23.54 at M_GUT to SM values at M_Z

bottom-quark-mass.label: (6.5) Bottom Quark Mass
bottom-quark-mass.description: Bottom quark mass from geometric Yukawa coupling

tau-lepton-mass.label: (6.6) Tau Lepton Mass
tau-lepton-mass.description: Tau lepton mass from geometric Yukawa coupling

higgs-mass.label: (5.7) Higgs Boson Mass
higgs-mass.description: Higgs mass is phenomenological INPUT that constrains Re(T) modulus
higgs-mass.notes: NOT a prediction - this is INPUT. The Re(T) = 7.086 value IS derived from m_h.
